CohortSymmetry 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

    A formatted visualization of sequence_symmetry objects.

    formatSequenceSymmetry.Rd

    It provides a formatted table with the contents of the getSequenceRatios output.

    Usage

    formatSequenceSymmetry(
  result,
  type = "gt",
  estimateNameFormat = c(`N (%)` = "<count> (<percentage> %)", `SR (CI)` =
    "<point_estimate> (<lower_CI> - <upper_CI>)"),
  style = "default",
  crude = TRUE,
  adjusted = TRUE,
  studyPopulation = TRUE,
  indexName = TRUE,
  markerName = TRUE,
  cdmName = TRUE,
  .options = NULL
)

    Arguments

    result

    A sequence_symmetry object.

    type

    Type of desired formatted table, possibilities: "gt", "flextable", "tibble".

    estimateNameFormat

    .

    style

    Named list that specifies how to style the different parts of a gt table or flextable. See visOmopResults package for more information on how to define a style. Alternatively, use "default" to get visOmopResults style, or NULL for gt/flextable default styling.

    crude

    whether to report crude results.

    adjusted

    whether to report adjusted results.

    studyPopulation

    whether to report the study population.

    indexName

    whether to report index names.

    markerName

    whether to report marker names

    cdmName

    whether to report database names.

    .options

    named list with additional formatting options. CohortSymmetry::formatSequenceSymmetryOptions() shows allowed arguments and their default values.

    Value

    A formatted version of the sequence_symmetry object.

    On this page
